what: feature store handler for the diseasy framework
title: feature store handler for the diseasy framework
text: “diseasystore” feature store implemented R specifically designed providing disease data pandemic preparedness.

title: feature store handler for the diseasy framework
text: “diseasystore” modularly built using R6 classes. Different diseases specified “case_definition” implements feature store access relevant disease data given case definition. Generic disease data one case definition also available case definitions reducing overhead data storage.

title: feature store handler for the diseasy framework
text: Data different diseases typically structured different ways. “diseasystore” includes examples implement disease data set. “diseasystore” designed handled individual level data (preferred) semi-aggregated data. data individual level, feature store fully dynamics can adapt (virtually) stratification user specifies. data conversely semi-aggregated, data can stratified levels semi-aggregation (higher levels).

title: SQL Joins — joins
text: Overloads dplyr _join accept na_by argument. default, joining using SQL match NA / NULL. dbplyr option "na_matches = na" match NA / NULL inefficient function matching efficiently. column contains NA / NULL, give argument na_by match join na_by given, function defaults using dplyr::_join

title: SQL Joins — joins
code: mg_inner_join(x, y, by = NULL, na_by = NULL, ...)

title: SQL Joins — joins
text: x, y pair data frames, data frame extensions (e.g. tibble), lazy data frames (e.g. dbplyr dtplyr). See Methods, , details. join specification created join_by(), character vector variables join . NULL, default, *_join() perform natural join, using variables common across x y. message lists variables can check correct; suppress message supplying explicitly. join different variables x y, use join_by() specification. example, join_by(== b) match x$y$b. join multiple variables, use join_by() specification multiple expressions. example, join_by(== b, c == d) match x$y$b x$c y$d. column names x y, can shorten listing variable names, like join_by(, c). join_by() can also used perform inequality, rolling, overlap joins. See documentation ?join_by details types joins. simple equality joins, can alternatively specify character vector variable names join . example, = c("", "b") joins x$y$x$b y$b. variable names differ x y, use named character vector like = c("x_a" = "y_a", "x_b" = "y_b"). perform cross-join, generating combinations x y, see cross_join(). na_by columns match NA ... parameters passed onto methods.

validity (valid_from and valid_until) — mg_interlace_sql

Combine any number of sql queries, where each has their own time axis of

Combine any number of sql queries, where each has their own time axis of
validity (valid_from and valid_until) — mg_interlace_sql
text: tables list(!) tables want combine supplied lazy_queries. (group) variable merge colnames time axes validity called "valid_to" "valid_until" inside lazy_query, can specify names supplying arguments list (e.g. c(t1.= "\<colname\>", t2.= "\<colname\>"). colnames must named order given tables (.e. t1, t2, t3, ...).

title: Update a historical table — mg_update_snapshot
code: mg_update_snapshot(   .data,   conn,   db_table,   timestamp,   filters = NULL,   message = NULL,   tic = Sys.time(),   log_path = getOption("mg.log_path"),   log_db = getOption("mg.log_db"),   enforce_chronological_order = TRUE )

title: Update a historical table — mg_update_snapshot
text: .data tbl object. Typically lazy query DB (mg::get_table()) conn object inherits DBIConnection (generated get_connection())' db_table Either dplyr connection target table specification 'schema.table' timestamp timestamp (POSIXct) update from_ts/until_ts columns filters filter subset data .  filters == NULL, filtering occurs. Else, mg_inner_join performed using columns filter message message add log-file (useful supplying metadata log) tic timestamp computation began. supplied, created call-time. (Used accurately convey long runtime update process ) log_path path logs stored. NULL, file logs created. log_db specification db logs stored ("schema.table"). NULL, db logs created. enforce_chronological_order logical controls whether check timestamp update prior timestamps DB
